instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKLT_PWM: What is BKLT_PWM? BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKLT_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
No liquid. 

Found that I am missing <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>. I have already replaced <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>. Still have the same result. Most recently replaced <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, also same result. 
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.38V.

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Try PRAM reset few times.
Do you know if this machine has EFI password?
Use external monitor for control.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message: Jump <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> for permanent full brightness it's going to have a dead GPU tomorrow anyways.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message: Ok , so I got it working.. . Just not sure what did it. I tried PRAM Reset as suggested when I came in this morning (Please not that <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> is removed at this time) and I still did not get a response from the Muix to send <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>. However I decided to put a second new <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> on and I booted and everything works , <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> is now present and I have a machine with backlight. Maybe the second reboot after replacing U901 got the Mux to send the signal? Or will it not send it without <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> present. In that case it was a faulty Mux. Thanks your help guys!
